item.title: Israeli Troops Occupy Syria Buffer Zone in Defensive Step
item.description: The move in the Golan Heights comes as Israel fears rebel groups could encroach on its border.

item.title: Inside Ukraine's Battle for the Skies as Russian Bombardments Hit Records
item.description: Moscow fired four times as many drones and missiles this fall as it did the previous year, according to a Wall Street Journal analysis.

item.title: A Sidelined Sitting President: South Korea's Leader Won't Run the Country
item.description: The ruling party and prime minister will handle state affairs, not Yoon Suk Yeol, after he briefly imposed martial law. The opposition calls the arrangement illegal.

item.title: The 11-Day Blitz by Syrian Rebels That Ended 50 Years of Assad Rule
item.description: Bashar al-Assad called for help from Russia, Iran and his own military in his last hours as Syria’s leader, learning he had run out of allies and loyalty.

item.title: Bashar al-Assad, an Ophthalmologist Who Became a Dictator, Is the Last of a Despotic Dynasty
item.description: Once a self-styled modernizer, Syria’s president bought time with a harsh crackdown, but his government eventually succumbed to its many enemies.

item.title: Assad's Rule Collapses in Syria, Raising Concerns of a Vacuum
item.description: The events set off celebrations among the population but also sparked concerns about how the disintegration of the regime would reverberate in the region.

item.title: What to Know About the Civil War in Syria
item.description: Rebel fighters seized Damascus and deposed President Assad, taking a more than decade-old conflict into a new phase.

item.title: Assad's Downfall Marks a New Realignment in the Middle East
item.description: Winners and losers have already emerged, Turkey gained, Russia and Iran lost sway—but the gains and losses could prove illusory.

item.title: As Russia and China Rewrite Rules of War, NATO Adapts Its Game Plan
item.description: Cyber and energy security are priorities for the alliance’s new leader, as member nations share more intelligence to protect critical infrastructure.

item.title: Syrian Government Teeters as Rebels Reach Damascus
item.description: The regime’s security forces and allies were apparently in retreat as President Bashar al-Assad’s whereabouts couldn’t be determined.

item.title: Retreat of Syrian Forces Threatens 'Saigon Moment' for Russia
item.description: Moscow’s support for the Assad regime has helped it project power throughout the region.

item.title: Notre Dame Cathedral Is Reborn in a Darkened World
item.description: The Gothic masterpiece reopened to a world buffeted by war and economic uncertainty, five years after a fire nearly destroyed it.

item.title: Syria's Assad Finds Himself Alone as Enemies Close In
item.description: Facing the collapse of his rule, President Bashar al-Assad sought help from his backers in Russia and Iran. He came away empty-handed.

item.title: 'Come Back!': A Surprise Boycott Saves South Korea's President from Impeachment
item.description: Opposition lawmakers vowed to keep trying to oust Yoon Suk Yeol for declaring martial law.

item.title: Inside a High-Stakes U.S.-China Prisoner Swap
item.description: A Stanford student and a Uyghur activist are among those who waged a long battle to get attention from Washington for family members jailed in China.

item.title: S.Korean President Apologizes---and Vows to 'Never' Declare Martial Law Again
item.description: Yoon Suk Yeol said his imposition of emergency powers was made out of desperation.

item.title: China Forex Reserves Climbed in November
item.description: China’s foreign-exchange reserves unexpectedly edged up in November, despite a weaker Chinese yuan against the U.S. dollar amid tariff threats from the impending second Trump administration.

item.title: Syrian Rebels' Lightning Offensive Zeroes In on Major City
item.description: Some Arab officials are urging President Bashar al-Assad to leave the country as a battle for Homs looms.

item.title: Romania Scraps Election After Russian Influence Allegations
item.description: The presidential election was canceled after the government accused Moscow of a TikTok campaign to propel a pro-Kremlin candidate to the fore.

item.title: EU, South American Bloc Strike Free-Trade Pact
item.description: The preliminary deal to lower tariffs​ amid protectionist headwinds would become the EU’s largest trade agreement if ratified.
